title: Dr. Marina Ivanova
text:
Twitter/X
  
  
    
     Github
  
  
    
     Google Scholar
  

  
  
I am a researcher in English linguistics at Chemnitz University of Technology, working in the areas of second language perception and production, corpus linguistics and academic writing.
Email: marina.ivanova[at]phil.tu-chemnitz.de







Date
News




16.12.24
New review paper on training English word stress with technology at EuroCALL Review!


10.07.24
Happy to announce my new DAAD project “I, Expert: Media competence for science through linguistics” in cooperation with the University of Zaragoza!


21.05.24
Excited for two new articles on “German English-medium linguistics journal abstracts over the last 30 years” and “English MA Theses at a German University before and after the Bologna reform” published in TOKEN: A Journal of English Linguistics. 16 (see Publications)


08.04.24
I am happy to join the project “Declining Case: Inflectional Loss in Progress” (University of Surrey) as a transcriber of Bulgarian interviews.


01.04.24
I am happy to join the TU Chemnitz English and Digital Linguistics team as a researcher (Wissenschaftliche Mitarbeiterin).


02.02.24
My PhD thesis on the perception and production of word stress cues in Slavic English varieties is now online.

title: Publications
text:
Ivanova, M. (2024). Training English word stress perception and production with technology. The EuroCALL Review, 31(2), 45-56. doi: 10.4995/eurocall.2024.20400
Albrecht, S., Ivanova, I., Schmied, J. (2024). Durational variation across inner/outer/expanding circle varieties of English. English World-Wide. doi: 10.1075/eww.23023.alb
Ivanova, M., Neubert, C. R., Schmied, J., & Bendixen, A. (2023). ERP evidence for Slavic and German word stress cue sensitivity in English. Frontiers in Psychology 14. doi: 10.3389/fpsyg.2023.1193822 (Preprint PsyArXiv doi: 10.31234/osf.io/hqr34)
Ivanova, M. & Schmied, J. (2023). From cues to features: Bridging psycho- and sociolinguistics in the development of non-native English stimuli. TESOL Communications 2(2), 1-17. doi: 10.58304/tc.20230201
Ivanova, M. (2023). German English-medium linguistics journal abstracts over the last 30 years: Quantitative and qualitative structural developments. TOKEN: A Journal of English Linguistics. 16, 89-113. https://token.ujk.edu.pl/wp-content/uploads/04_M_Ivanova.pdf
Schmied, J., & Ivanova, M. (2023). English MA Theses at a German University before and after the Bologna reform: Comparing global rhetorical structures and stance in Linguistics and Cultural Studies. TOKEN: A Journal of English Linguistics. 16, 169-196. https://token.ujk.edu.pl/wp-content/uploads/07_J_Schmied_M_Ivanova.pdf
Ivanova, M. (accepted). Training word stress perception and production with technology. The EUROCALL Review.

title: Publications
text:
Edited volumes

Schmied, J., & Ivanova, M. (Eds.) (2023). Comparing confidence and trust online and offline. REAL19. Cuvillier.
Schmied, J., Dheskali, J., & Ivanova, M. (Eds.) (2022). From uncertainty to confidence and trust. Cuvillier.

title: Publications
text:
Contributions to edited volumes

Ivanova, M. (2022). Uncertainty in postgraduate training and supervision: A needs analysis for online course development. In J. Schmied, J. Dheskali, & M. Ivanova (Eds.), From uncertainty to confidence and trust (pp. 131-146). Cuvillier.
Ivanova, M. (2020). Semantic and pragmatic truth implications of concession in single- and double-blind open peer reviews. In J. Schmied & J. Dheskali (Eds.), Conflicting truths in academic and journalistic writing (pp. 141-156). Cuvillier.
Petrovska, I., & Ivanova, M. (2020). Teaching lexical patterns in English and Macedonian media discourse: Confronting issues of conflicting truths. In J. Schmied & J. Dheskali (Eds.), Conflicting truths in academic and journalistic writing (pp. 269-282). Cuvillier.

title: Publications
text:
Book reviews

Ivanova, M. (2022). [Review of the book Scientific and Parascientific Communication edited by P. Mur-Dueñas and R. Lorés] Discourse and Interaction 15(2), 151-154. https://journals.muni.cz/discourse-and-interaction/article/view/32959
Ivanova, M. (2021). [Review of the book Academic Writing with Corpora. A Resource Book for Data-Driven Learning, by T. Karpenko-Seccombe] Discourse and Interaction, 14(2), 126-130. https://journals.muni.cz/discourse-and-interaction/article/view/18670/14733

title: Curriculum Vitae
text:
Researcher 2024 - today English and Digital Linguistics, TU Chemnitz
Scientific assistant 2019 - 2022 English Language and Linguistics, TU Chemnitz - Coordinator of two DAAD projects with Southeast Europe - Statistical analysis, corpus preparation, annotation of sociolinguistic interviews, research and editing 
Internship Linguistics 03 - 05.2020 VICO Research and Consulting near Stuttgart - Modeling of search queries for social media monitoring on customer topics - Annotation of posts from the social web according to tonality 
Scientific assistant 2017 - 2019 English Literatures, TU Chemnitz

title: Curriculum Vitae
text:
Researcher 2024 - today English and Digital Linguistics, TU Chemnitz
Scientific assistant 2019 - 2022 English Language and Linguistics, TU Chemnitz - Coordinator of two DAAD projects with Southeast Europe - Statistical analysis, corpus preparation, annotation of sociolinguistic interviews, research and editing 
Internship Linguistics 03 - 05.2020 VICO Research and Consulting near Stuttgart - Modeling of search queries for social media monitoring on customer topics - Annotation of posts from the social web according to tonality

text:
Education
PhD, English Language and Linguistics, Chemnitz University of Technology 2020 - 01.2024 “Perception and production of word stress cues in Slavic English varieties” (summa cum laude)
MA English and American Studies at TU Chemnitz 2017 - 2020
BA English and American Studies at TU Chemnitz 2014 - 2017
Semester abroad at Université de Poitiers, France 2016 - 2017

title: Curriculum Vitae
text:
Skills
Bulgarian (native), English (fluent), German (fluent) Statistical analysis - R, Matlab Phonetic analysis and resynthesis - Praat Transcription and annotation of audio data - Praat, ELAN, GAT Text analysis and annotation - AntConc, INCEpTION, Python Version control – Git

title: Curriculum Vitae
text:
Organisation
Organised workshops and summer schools in the frame of the DAAD projects “From Uncertainty to Confidence and Trust” (2020), “Constructing Confidence and Trust Online” (2021) and “Comparing Confidence and Trust Online and Offline” (2022).

title: Curriculum Vitae
text:
Memberships
International Society for the Linguistics of English (ISLE) 2024 - present Deutsche Gesellschaft für Sprachwissenschaft (DGfS) 2024 - present Associated member at the Collaborative Research Center “Hybrid Societies”, TU Chemnitz 2022 - 2023

title: Curriculum Vitae
text:
Research stays
Data acquisition at the Masaryk University Brno, Czech Republic 30.10-04.11.22, 8-12.11.21

title: Curriculum Vitae
text:
Additional activities
Bulgarian transcriber for “Declining Case: Inflectional Loss in Progress”, University of Surrey 2024 - today Alumna ambassador for the TU Chemnitz for Bulgaria 2023 - 2025 Summer School “Digital Humanities” at UNIMORE Modena, Italy 2021, 2022 Assistant of international students at the TU Chemnitz Student Buddy program 2015 - 2023 Student ambassador of the English Department publishing blog posts on Campus TUschler 2015 - 2020

title: Talks and Workshops
text:
Albrecht, S., Isiaka, A., Ivanova, M. (15.07.23). “Igbo and Yoruba English vowel spaces compared”. Digital English World Wide in Chemnitz.
Albrecht, S., Schmied, J., Ivanova, M. (15-17.06.23). “Comparing vowel spaces across three circles: A quantitative corpus-based approach” IAWE25.
Schmied, J., Albrecht, S., Ivanova, M. (15-17.06.23). “Empirical perception studies on Italian English: Neglected, charming or unaccepted?”. IAWE25.
Ivanova, M. (17-25.05.23). “Competent but cold: Learning outcomes using a pedagogical agent speaking native and non-native varieties”. Alexander-von-Humboldt Linguistic Marathon “Empirical English Studies: Discourse-, Corpus-, Psycho- & Computer-Linguistic Approaches” in Brno (CZ), Klagenfurt (AT), Padova, Ferrara, and Modena (IT).
Albrecht & Ivanova, M. (30.08.22). “Talking about news articles related to the Covid Pandemic on Twitter. Global Discourse and Intertextuality”. Talk at the European Society for the Study of English Conference 2022 Mainz. GitLab repository: https://mytuc.org/vkjk
Ivanova, M. (07.06.22). “German English-medium linguistics journal abstracts over the last 30 years: Quantitative and qualitative structural developments.” Talk at the Summer School Digital Humanities at the University of Modena and Reggio Emilia (Italy) 06-10 June 2022.
Ivanova, M. (26.05.22). “Open digital peer conference reviews: Towards a transparent constructive critical discourse to advance science”. Talk at the online International Conference “Digital Genres and Open Science” at the University of Zaragoza (Spain) 26-27 May 2022.
Schmied, J. & Ivanova, M. (02.09.21). “Academic Writing Conventions in English MA Theses before and after Bologna: Global Rhetorical Structures and Stance in Sub-Disciplines at a German University”. Seminar talk at the 2021 online ESSE conference.
Ivanova, M. & Schmied, J. (10.08.20). “Uncertainty in postgraduate training and supervision: A needs analysis for online course development”. Digital English World-Wide conference online.
Ivanova, M. (06.07.19). “Semantic and pragmatic truth implications of concession in single- and double-blind open peer review.” Digital English World-Wide conference in Chemnitz. ## Workshops
28-30.03.22. Online Workshop Hands-on formatting with MS Word and reference management with Zotero. TEFL-ePal Dissemination.
23.11.21. “Hands-on Corpus Linguistics workshop. The Corona Corpus (Davies 2019-) and AntConc (Anthony 2020)”. Formatting workshop.
10.11.21. Hands-on introductory workshop with R. Faculty of Pedagogy, Masaryk University Brno.
12.10.21. Interview preparation. Introduction to data processing with Praat (Boersma & Weenink 2021) CASE PhD workshop.
15.12.20. What the APA 7 teaches us outside citation and formatting. Workshop at the online Chemnitz Africa/Asia Symposium on English (CASE).
27.10.20. Smart online research and discourse annotation. Workshop at the online Summer School From Uncertainty to Confidence and Trust.
25.08.19. Beyond the 6 WH: Preparing, conducting and presenting impactful interviews. Workshop at the Summer School Conflicting Truths in Academic and Journalistic Writing in Ohrid, N. Macedonia.
